title: Organic matter decreases in soil from agriculture

content.question: Long-term intensive agriculture that does not add soil amendments such as manure or fertilizer has been shown to decrease soil organic matter content. Which of the following figures best shows this relationship?

choices.label: Each option presents a graph with the vertical axis labeled Soil Organic Matter. Option A presents a graph of a straight line. The horizontal axis is labeled p H. The graph starts high on the left and slopes down toward the right, ending on the horizontal axis.
Option B presents a graph of a straight line. The horizontal axis is labeled Time. The graph starts at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes and slopes upward and to the right.

Option C presents a graph of a curved line. The horizontal axis is labeled Time. The graph starts high on the left and curves gradually down and towards the right, leveling off at a low value near the horizontal axis on the right.

Option D presents a graph of a curved line. The horizontal axis is labeled Soil Depth. The graph starts at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes and curves upward and to the right and becomes almost vertical two-thirds of the way along the horizontal axis.

Option E presents a graph of a curved line. The horizontal axis is labeled Crop Production. The graph starts slightly above intersection of the horizontal and vertical axes; initially the line is somewhat flat and then curves slightly upwards and to the right.

content.answer: Option C presents a graph of a curved line. The horizontal axis is labeled Time. The graph starts high on the left and curves gradually down and towards the right, leveling off at a low value near the horizontal axis on the right.
